content.description:
Pull onto a solid face off a ledge with cool left hand side pulls and a few right crimps (roof is about 20 feet up off the deck). Move up to a good jug under the roof - I found placements for .5 / .75 Camalots here. Pull the roof or stay left, rock here is choss but adds to the spice and the climbing is easy . Also, if you get sketched out there's bolts on the 5.8 to the left. Use the anchor's for the 5.8 to the left. Put 4 pieces in.

Can be top roped by leading humpty.

Might be a duplicate of

https://www.mountainproject.com/route/105850154/pump-for-the-plump,

used the same rating, not sure since the description isn't great and no picture. Will fix if needed.
content.protection: Small to medium gear, smaller master cams and camalots.

content.description: Fun face climbing is broken by a ledge.
Vertical face with devious key holds.

About 40 feet left of the pine tree is a slightly right-trending, left facing seam.  Climb this past the initial tough move using the horizontal cracks for gear.  Angle right to a dirty, loose, lichen-infested corner to the rock filled ledge above.  This route unlike it's sister, Dreamboat Annie, is not worth your time.
content.protection: Small cams will protect you on the lower face.  The upper corner needs a prayer and some glue.  Very loose.  I had a blue Wild Country zero in a slot that wouldn't have held me, if I fell.  There are chains above Dreamboat Annie, but they are 40 feet away, which requires either a gear anchor or a good directional system set up.  Neither which is very probable to be successfull in sticking without pulling down a mess of rocks.  Wear your helmet and don't fall, or better yet stay away.

content.description: The beta is in the name.
A variety of techniques are required to go straight up this blocky wall. More stable than it appears from below.
Just left of the pine tree is a crack that climbs to a ledge just right of the small overhang.  Continue up this crack system, angling left near the top for the chains.  Easy holds for easy climbing.
content.protection: 2 chains for the anchors.  3 or 4 pieces are all that are needed 1 medium, 1 large, 1 small, and 1 of your choice.  It protects well and is short.  Rappel off.

content.description: Stage same as Jump at the Lump. Veer right at the bump.
content.protection: Bolts and a 2” cam. 2 bolt station on ledge.

content.description: Some wildly fun tree stemming may be in order for those unable to discern the first steep section. A short and strenuous sequence at the top is the crux for most folks.
